title: APT to Present in Three Educational Sessions at NACS Show 2015
text:
Applied Predictive Technologies announced today that it will be presenting in three educational sessions at the NACS Show in Las Vegas on October 11th, 2015.
Washington, D.C. (PRWEB) October 01, 2015
Applied Predictive Technologies (APT) announced today that it will be presenting in three educational sessions at the NACS Show in Las Vegas on October 11th, 2015. APT is a leading cloud-based analytics software company that works with a number of convenience leaders – including Wawa, Thorntons, Maverik, United Dairy Farmers, Shell, and Sunoco – to help them improve their strategies through in-market experimentation. NACS – The Association for Convenience and Fuel Retailing – serves the convenience and fuel retailing industry by providing industry knowledge, connections and advocacy to ensure the competitive viability of its members' businesses. The NACS Show attracts over 23,500 industry stakeholders from around the world.
APT will present in the following three sessions:
Minding Your Business Intelligence – Sunday October 11th at 2:00pm in Pavilion 9: In this IT-focused session, APT Senior Vice President Marek Polonski will present on how using advanced analytics can drastically change decisions as compared to more basic reporting. Is That a Smart Promotion? How to Monetize Your POS Data – Sunday October 11th at 2:00pm in Pavilion 2/3: APT Vice President Jeff Campbell will walk through the steps convenience store operators can take to use their transactional data to improve promotion and merchandising decisions. Double Down on Your Customer Engagement Strategy – Sunday October 11th at 4:10pm in Pavilion 2/3: Jeff Campbell will co-present with a convenience leader about ways in which convenience store organizations can use their customer data to design smarter offers and better engage their customers.
“Is That a Smart Promotion? How to Monetize Your POS Data” and “Double Down on Your Customer Engagement Strategy” will be translated in Spanish and Portuguese.
To learn more about Big Data and analytics, read "The Discipline of Business Experimentation": http://download.predictivetechnologies.com/hbr-disciplineofbusinessexperimentation-nacspr .
To learn more about this year’s NACS Show, visit http://www.nacsonline.com/NACSShow .
About APT
APT is a leading cloud-based analytics software company that enables organizations to rapidly and precisely measure cause-and-effect relationships between business initiatives and outcomes to generate economic value. Our intuitive and proprietary Test & Learn® software utilizes sophisticated algorithms to analyze large amounts of data, enabling business leaders to conduct experiments and allowing them to make optimal decisions and implement business initiatives at scale. We also offer products that support decision-making for specific business needs including transaction analysis, space planning, promotion design, category management and location selection. APT’s client portfolio features some of the world’s best known brands, including Walmart, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, Victoria’s Secret, American Family, Hilton Hotels, SUBWAY, TD Bank, T-Mobile, and others. APT has offices in Washington, D.C., San Francisco, London, Bentonville, Taipei, Tokyo, Sydney, and Chicago. Visit http://www.predictivetechnologies.com to learn more.
